Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE THE REDBURY!”
Reviews.Author: eelnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Redbury and LOVED every aspect of the hotel. I would say the design is vintage Hollywood mixed with ultra modern elemebts. The rooms are huge, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. During our stay room service arrived in minutes, the valet always had our car waiting at the door and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. The Redbury is centrally located for anywhere you might need to go. We in late one night and got roomservice from Cleo, the restaurant in the hotel, and it was a great meal (Probably the best room service I ever had). Cant say enought about this place. This is THE place to stay in LA! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for extended stays”
Reviews.Author: Gnat
Reviews.Content: I stayed for an entire week at The Redbury while on business and the extra living space and kitchen area was definitely a bonus for the extended stay. Here are the details: the kitchen has a sink, microwave, Kuerig coffee maker and a small mini fridge, the sitting area has a comfy couch and several chairs with a flat screen on a swivel, the bedroom has ample storage, a ceiling fan and the bed was nice and soft, the bathroom sink area was a little cramped but the shower was amazing. My only gripe about the hotel was the noise from the courtyard on certain nights, but that can be drowned out by turning on the bathroom fan or running the a/c fan. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with some negative experiences”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Min
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Hollywood for 4 days and stayed 3 nights in this hotel. Unique and beautiful interior with above average service. Room is very clean and spacious. Location of the hotel is not bad, only a few mins walk to metro station (if you are going to Universal Studio, the easiest way is taking the metro heading North Hollywood direction for 2 stops and there is free studio shuttle tram taking you to the theme park.) and about 20 to 25 mins walk to Highland Center and Kodak Theater. Be aware if you book their Highland Flats type room, you will be sleeping beside a night club and you WILL hear and feel the music base all night long. My husband couldn't fall asleep till 5 in the morning for the first night and he had to use ear plugs for the other two nights. If you are a light sleeper, spend more money and book the more expensive room that is facing the court yard instead. Also there are no view from this room type. We are on the 5th floor (the top floor) and all we can see from the window and balcony is the concrete side wall of the night club next door. Another complain I got is the water pressure of their rain shower head. the water pressure was so weak that i feel like I can never wash off the bubbles on me. The kitchen inside the room is amazing. There is an actual stove you can cook on and the pot and pan are all prepared for you. Living room is large and comfy, and I love the turntable record player. We played it every night before sleep and in the morning when we were getting ready. This is our first wedding anniversary trip and I wish it could be more perfect, but sadly the night club ruined it for us. Next time when we visit, we will not be staying here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Tickle your senses in a 20's inspired ambient. Great food and coctkail restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Hakire
Reviews.Content: You'll be amazed by the semplicity and yet the surprise of the menu. rich pearls of flavours with an incredible balance between spices, herbs and vegetables. the pita bread comes warm to taste the dippings. hummus and yogurt dippings were very smooth and tasty. cotkails are made of fresh fruits and they are the perfect combination to the food: the cucumber with a touch of chile is refreshing and tickling for the mouth while the blueberry one is amazingly well balanced in sweetness...could drink more than one easily. all the senses are embraced in the decadend atmosphere, a little in the 20´s mood, with soft light and art deco inspiration. I will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Spacious and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Ben C
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at The Redbury. I went for work and they gave us an extremely reasonable group rate. They entire staff was very friendly and helpful with a unique situation I had regarding my food truck. The rooms were really spacious, well-kept and comfortable and would be perfect for an extended stay. The location is great and the bar and lounge was a fun spot for a drink as well. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! Loved this ecclectic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bindiy
Reviews.Content: Right on Hollywood strip. Reception could not be more helpful. Loved the decor, very old Hollywood. Huge funky rooms with full kitchen, lounge area, turntable record player with current popular music. Private balcony, big bathroom and closet and most comfortable bed. The restaurant is hip and popular with Hollywoodites, great mediterranean cuisine. Loved the central courtyard open in Summer with bar service. Not cheap and not Beverly Hills but if want interesting Hollywood stay...not another Marriot then this is great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and pricey, but nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: MollyColly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Redbury for 3 nights at the start of a 3 week USA trip. The room: Very nice, the room was as it appears in the photographs, large and roomy. The bed was soooooo comfortable as was the bedding and pillows. The bathroom was large as was the shower, but there was too little pressure in the rain shower head that the water barely dribbled out. I did ask for the room to be away from the nightclub nearby, but we were situated on the same street and it did get very noisy late at night, not so much from the music but from the clientele of the club outside while lining up to get in and when leaving the club. We had a balcony which faced Vine Street and a view of Capitol Records. A continental breakfast was included in our booking, but not worth it as it only included a coffee and a piece of toast or a muffin. There is a house car which we took advantage of for a trip to Universal Studios and a trip to the open air mall. The staff: The staff were nice, particularly Ellis who was lovely, very helpful and obliging and very polite. Location: I was concerned at the location before booking as it was a 10-15 minute walk to most hotels and restaurants and all the action but booked anyway based on reviews that the distance was no biggie. The 15 minute walk did grow a bit old very quickly, particularly after walking and touring all day and then venturing out again for dinner. More particularly at night when walking back and there were a couple of undesirable looking groups of people wandering about. Place to eat: 'Wood and Vine' just down the road on Hollywood Blvd, food is great. Place to drink: 'Five 0 Four' bar on Hollywood Blvd Tip: Take one of the open topped van tours around Beverley Hills and Rodeo Drive, a bit kitschey but a lot of fun Conclusion: While we liked the Redbury, I probably wouldnt stay there again, I would probably look at the Renaissance Hotel or the Roosevelt Hotel for a more central location for convenience only.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, pleasant , but confused front desk”
Reviews.Author: glu
Reviews.Content: The Redbury is perfectly located at Hollywood and Vine! A stroll down the street puts you right in all the kitschy Hollywood action. The decor is a very lush with a hint of musk in the air. The rooms are spacious flats with a well stocked kitchen, wide kitchen bar, funky furniture and a great mattress. The valets were the nicest, most helpful young men, especially when we misplaced our cell phone. The front desk staff was extremely pleasant, but were clueless regarding the package we had booked. We are part of the I Prefer group-which is the reason we chose the Redbury. The front desk totally bungled our room type, our rate, our included breakfast, and early check-in/late check-out benefits. After several different clerks, and multiple phone calls, it all was fixed, but exhausted us. Then our room had a broken clock, broken safe, a non-functioning deadbolt, and a set of blinds that fell on my son's head. Room service was noted to be 24 hours, but you could not order your breakfast the night before. And when we tried to order at 7 am, no one was in to take the order!?! Our food arrived promptly, but without napkins. All of this was fixed with each front desk call, but we began to worry that the hotel was more focused on the trendy look, rather than good service. After the first 24 hours, the remainder of the stay was without a hitch, until the bill came and charged us for our free internet. It was promptly corrected. With a bit more training of the front deck and a bit more attention to the room upkeep, this would have been an excellent hotel. We would come back, but just watch that you get everything you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Paulie C
Reviews.Content: First, this is a very cool place. Recently renovated in a funky style, the rooms are really apartments with separate living and sleeping areas and a comfortable kitchenette. The pictures on the web site are exactly how the room looked, and it was comfortable, relaxing and a pleasant place to settle down after doing the town. When we booked we asked if we could have a "quiet" room, knowing there was a nightclub next door, and when we checked in we were told they saved the room farthest from the club for us. What attention to the customer's wants. No question, a first class place and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kreyner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Redbury hotel for 2 nights with my mom and my sister. We stayed in the 'base' flat (not sure what one?) and it was really spacious! It is open concept with the only door being a sliding door that separates the toilet from the rest of the bathroom (which was actually nice for 3 women sharing / trying to all get ready at the same time!). We did have to call the front desk a few times as the toilet kept getting clogged with nothing but toilet paper or kleenex in it. The shower also had a glass wall that faced the bed, which could be weird depending on who you're staying with! The record player was great and a really fun feature. I also LOVED the decor and the art was all very interesting. The kitchen had just what we needed - a sink, a few burners, a lot of counter space, and lots of drinking glasses. The mini bar was not so mini! We didn't take anything, but it was reasonably priced (I actually think the $7 Heineken was more expensive at a restaurant we went to!). There were only 2 coffees (keurig - yum!) so we called the front desk and they brought us up more right away, and the cleaning staff refilled it with 3 which was nice. There was not, however, any laundry soap. We probably could have just asked for it but we decided not to bother as we were just getting ready to go out for the day. The King bed was SUPER comfortable (which I shared with my mom) and we got a cot brought up for my sister. So not ideal sleeping situation for 'non couples' but we made it work. We had a spacious balcony (for a hotel room) that overlooked the courtyard, which was nice as my mom is a smoker. It DID get quite loud at night so if you can't sleep with background noise than this might bother you. I bring earplugs when I travel so I used those and had no problem sleeping. My mother and sister didn't have earplugs but still slept no problem. It was like having the radio on as you fall asleep... :) The staff was really friendly, the location was good (about a 10-15 minute walk to Hollywood and Highland / Grauman Theatre etc) and just around the corner from Pantages Theatre. If you want to have a true Hollywood experience, then stay here! We saved a bit of money by going to the Trader Joe's around the corner and getting snacks, to make up for the pricey rooms (about $350/night). All in all it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoanneRI
Reviews.Content: We were at the Redbury for just a weekend and we enjoyed the unusual decor and the friendly staff. I am surprised, though, that the lobby, soap, and body lotion had an odd, musky, incense-like smell. so bring your own if that bothers you. There was a stain on the sofa, too. On the plus side, the rooms were very large and comfortable, and the location was great. There was a nice big kitchen and a washer/dryer.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: carrom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the funky decor, the really spacious suite (there were 4 of us) and the kitchen. We didn't use the balcony much as no view on 2nd floor and a bit gloomy. The staff were friendly and laid back. Location is great if you like the mix of seedy, touristy and glam which makes up the neighbourhood. Some good clubs and restaurants - liked Katsuya, didn't like Beso just down the road. But it's a good place to walk around day and night which is not that usual in LA. Would definitely return to the Redbury.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: DMF3758
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is a really great hotel.I stayed here twice in Feruary in two different rooms. I don't feel any need to stay anywhere else in LA (Unless budget is a constraint). This is a real five star hotel with great character and a tremendous level of service. The rooms are stunning. Huge high ceilinged suites with marvellously decadent decoration and a four poster bed. Each room is equipped with a vintage record player and a selection of albums! The kitchen is beautifully equipped and the bathrooms are great. Each room also has a spacious balcony. Room service arrived in 5 minutes with a meal ordered from the excellent mediterranean restaurant. The selection of drinks and snacks in the room is imaginative and extensive. Check in staff are super helpful. I overheard one of them sending out a taxi to find a guest who had got lost somewhere in LA ! Of course all this comes at a price (overnight parking is $37!) and the rooms come at around $320-$350 a night, but in a way it is excellent value for money and nothing here is done on the cheap. There is even a washing machine hidden away in one of the cupboards. The one draw back is perhaps the noise. Avoid the rooms that give onto the club next door on the North side. On my first night there was a live concert going on until midnight. Luckily it was a great concert which we enjoyed without having to pay for tickets! The rooms that look out onto Vine are also a little noisy at night. The quieter rooms look out onto an internal courtyard, but then they don't have the great views from the balcony This a really great experience and you could happily live here for an extended period if you had the money!

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous Rock n Roll Vibe”
Reviews.Author: jrsteele87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on the way to New Zealand and it was honestly one of the best parts of the trip! The service was beyond excellent but without the stuffy, pretentious feel. The decor was super cool throughout and the room was even better. It's not very often you get to play a Van Morrison vinyl on your own turntable. :) Though it is on the expensive end, it is well worth every dollar, plus the location is unbeatable. If you are in LA, treat yourself to a night (or two) in this fabulous spot!

Reviews.Title: “VIP Treatment!!!! I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Japen G
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place that was in hollywood that was accessible to all the venues at night. An online broker highly recommended this place and the rates were very reasonable. As it turns out, this place is a converted condo / apartment so size was going to be larger than the average hotel. I got the 2 bedroom suite and boy was is huge! Its true... size does matter. But not only was the size of the room amazing but the decor was chic. Leather sofas, flat panels in every room, king and queen size beds that were ultra comfortable. The record player was a nice touch but was skipping when I first turn it on. I quick call to the host desk and they immediately sent someone to fix it. Service. Service at Redbury is probably the highest reason why I was so please with my stay. I am not a night owl nor do I know any hollywood nightlife. So I relied a little bit on the hotel on their recommendations. First of, they recommended a restaurant called Saint Felix, which was absolutely fabulous, when the restaurant below couldn't accommodate our party. Then knowing that it could be difficult to get around and get in at some of the venues, I again turned to the hotel hosts (one of which was TJ who was the most accommodating) and ask for suggestions and they gave me some recommendations and they made some calls and they got my group in with serious VIP treatment. My boys were out for a good time to spend a night with a certain gentleman who will be taking his vows to be with the woman he loves. Redbury made the difference and made it a night that we will always remember. From the amazing hospitality service, to the comfortable room that had all the amenities that we could look for at a luxury hotel, to the amazing valet service (yes it was a pricey rate for overnight $37) that kept taking our cars out because someone would have to get something. Valet service was a phone call away. AMAZING!!! Did not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly unique”
Reviews.Author: MercerFlorida
Reviews.Content: If you want a rustic old hollywood feel this is your place. its NEW but has an old romantic feel to it. A cool surprise awaits you in every room, i don't want to spoil it by saying what it is though! The place is very quiet too. much better than the adjacent W hotel party scene. Restaurant below is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the coolest hotel in LA!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQinHou
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing! From the moment you drive into the red velvet curtained valet parking area, you know you are in for a treat! I was traveling with two teenage daughters (who have traveled extensively) and even they were impressed. All of the staff was extremely helpful (and all looked like aspiring models/actors.) They remembered us by name all 4 days, and gave us great suggestions on restaurants. We had a two bedroom corner apartment. Each room only had a queen bed, but it was comfortable. The rooms are decorated in a cool retro loft style. Very cozy. We had a balcony overlooking the hills and Capital Records. There is some street noise, but it didn't bother us. We also had a full kitchen with a stocked pantry and fridge, but since there is no room service, we stocked up with breakfast food, snacks and drinks. Just go to yummy.com and they will deliver your groceries within 30 minutes for a total cost of $5.00. Much cheaper than eating the stocked food, and more selection. Katsuya is a fabulous sushi restaurant right next door and owned by the hotel and they deliver.(It is very nice and also a celeb hang-out.) The Redbury lobby bar and restaurant is also replete with fabulous food, service, and a handful of famous faces. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; however, street noise is an issue!”
Reviews.Author: Coffeeaddict17
Reviews.Content: Arrived early in the morning as one does from an Australia flight and was greeted by Susanna with the promise that my request for an early check in was in the process of being organised and my room would be ready within the hour. Leaving the hotel with a very handy map and directions of how to reach the nearest CVS and supermarket (Trader Joe’s) I was on my way. From the hotel it is a very easy walk into Hollywood to see the sights and have access to an abundance of tour companies to take you further on your sightseeing desires. There is a Trader Joe’s down from the hotel on Vine Street where you can buy delicious fresh food to fill up your mini fridge and cupboards. The Redbury doesn’t have its own spa; however, it is a quick 5-minute walk to the Bliss Spa attached to the W hotel and that is a great spa for a few hours of pampering. The house car is a blessing and I used it over two days to take me to the Beverly Centre and The Grove. They don’t usually do pick up, but you can ring the hotel and if the car is not busy they will pick you up for a return trip which I was very lucky enough to secure on one of my days. Otherwise there is an abundance of taxis around to bring you back to the hotel, but be warned very few know where the hotel is and will ask you for the address so have it handy! The rooms are great size, think studio apartment size, with a kitchenette stocked with a mini fridge, microwave and a coffee maker. A sitting area and balcony, mine had a view of Capital Records, comfy bed, great sized bathroom and shower and a washing machine/dryer which I found to be very handy as a traveller with limited clothing selections and a stay of 5 nights. The only downside I found with the hotel is the street noise it really is an issue. I used the knowledge of other reviewers and asked for a quite room away from the nightclub, which stopped the thumping music noise; however, the street noise once the nightclub has closed rages on past 3am in the morning. I was on the third floor facing Vine Street and the street noise was terrible, perhaps it might be a little better if you have a higher floor or are facing away from the street. I returned one evening to the nightclub ablaze with flashing police lights and an extended police presence. The nightclub was closed for whatever reason after the police presence and what a difference in the street noise! I had two uninterrupted nights of sleep. Great hotel with excellent service and friendly staff who are knowledgeable about the surrounding areas and are more than happy to help you in anyway they can. Downside is the terrible street noise! Would I stay again? On my own for a relaxing get away, unfortunately no. With my family of teenagers, yes they would definitely enjoy the noise and excitement of the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service which made it an Amazing stay.”
Reviews.Author: CHKmonto
Reviews.Content: My partner and I loved our stay here! Having been to LA a few times I can say that this was a fantastic experience. Great room and vibe coupled with excellent staff (Susanna). Always looking for new experiences in LA, Susanna recommended excellent restaurants and night life that suited our 'theme' for the night. Always with a smile and warm greeting, the service we received was outstanding. The rooms are large, comfy beds, great food in the hotels restaurant.... highly recommend & would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: dexter619
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. decorated so nicely with very friendly staff and an unbelievable room. I stayed here for my birthday weekend and invited friends for drinks at the library bar. Meagan our server was awesome and the drinks were delicious and strong. about a dozen of us went back to my room afterward and that was great. the balcony is enclosed and it overlooked vine street. can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully eclectic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kilimjay
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay the rooms are huge by normal standards and the style is varied from retro to modern. Wonderfully helpful staff. Restaurant on the ground floor buzzing with atmosphere and a great variety of small plates - delicious. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a cool place”
Reviews.Author: Ron74
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool hotel with a great vibe. Rooms all have phonographs and come with a couple old vinyls. No pool, so not a place just to hang out during the day, but a great place for a fun evening. The staff is really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lii7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay. I loved the retro feel of the hotel and the room was huge. The staff were extreemly helpful. I emailed them before we came and they responded very quickly. They were helpful and suggested things to do and set up a tour for us. I would definatly stay there again. The only thing that might be a problem for some people was the air freshner in the room. It was a very nice smell but could cause problems for someone with allergies. We ate at Cleo and the food was yummy. The only things was that there appeared to be a separate sitting area for hotel guests. I was disapointed in this as apparently famous people go there and I was hoping to see some. lol

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Amenities”
Reviews.Author: CavalliBeachHouse
Reviews.Content: Amazing room, huge kitchen, living room & balcony with a view of the HOLLYWOOD sign and the walk of fame below. Record player in the room with a great selection of LPs. Super friendly and very helpful staff. Couldn't have asked for more. Fantastic value for money. Coming back in Feb!!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat in the heart of Hollywood. This hotel is gorgeous. The decor opulent!”
Reviews.Author: Julia B
Reviews.Content: It felt like being on the set of an old style Hollywood movie. Gorgeous apartments with rich bed coverlets, cushions and retro appointments. My daughter and I loved it. The staff were lovely. We needed to get to Universal studios. When we mentioned this to the staff they offered to drive us the hotel BMW free of charge! We loved the restaurant on the ground floor. The food, wine and service was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A++”
Reviews.Author: Scott E
Reviews.Content: After staying one night at The Redbury, I inquired if I could live there full time. Give it a try, I promise this hotel will move to the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a celebrity.”
Reviews.Author: sarahmgamble
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! The staff truly made us feel at home. Everything was so beautifully decorated and clean. I was always excited to go back to the hotel after a long day! Loved it & would completely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you want to party or stay up all night”
Reviews.Author: plhughes
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed hotel in heart of Hollywood with nice large rooms and friendly staff but with a major downside issue: be ready for techno drumbeat till 6 a.m. With shouts of departing partiers and then the shouts and noise of workers throwing away the empty bottles in the adjacent alley. Ugh. Was proud to have stayed up late but was not prepared for all night loud techno drumbeat that got even louder at 3 am. Staff apologized yet are powerless. Admit it was a Saturday night but all night? If you stay ask for rom away from the disco and alley and hope it is quiet enough. Or just plan to stay up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Rocker-Chic Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fashionlvr
Reviews.Content: The room is very spacious and beautifully decorated. Felt like a home with a fully equipped kitchen, dining table, living room, a large shower stall, washer/dryer and lots of closets. We shopped for food a Trader Joe's a few blocks away and saved money on breakfast and a few lunches. We even had guests over for pre-dinner drinks and appetizers and all were impressed with the hotel and room. The washer/dryer is very slow but I did a wash load every night and switch it to dry during the day. We had freshly laundered clothes daily and no pile of laundry to do when we got home. There is a very chic/cool vibe to the hotel. They have a phonograph with an assortment of LP 's.....i really enjoyed that. Very centrally located for shopping, dining and sight seeing. My only 2 complaints are the room service was not up to par with a luxury hotel, and my room was facing a night club which was a bit noisy. I would request a courtyard facing room in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down one of the best values in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: TheHonestWord
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this property probably about 7 or 8 times since their opening, I can fully recommend your next Hollywood visit to be at this uniquely charming hotel. The rooms are spacey; 750sqft minimum for each room as the property was originally built to be condo units. Great amenities from washer/dryers in each room, 2 flat screens per room, available complimentary I-Pad uses, amongst a plethora of other great treats & treasures. In it's first year of opening, prices were much more reasonable; as of late, the price increases seem to be a little much but the quality of rooms & service still makes it one of the best values in LA. The off-putting things about this property are that room service comes from the in-house restaurant Cleo and next door's Katsuya (both great restaurants); both charge a delivery fee in addition to the hefty gratuity which is odd since Cleo is in-house? I can order to-go, travel down 5 floors (the hotel is only 5 stories total so it's not far no matter which floor your room is on) and just bring it up to my room rather than pay that delivery fee: it's more like a "if-you-are- -too-lazy-to-come-get-it-yourself-expect-to-be-charged" type of fee. The ice-machine is a pain; there is only 1 ice-machine located on the 4th floor but I consider a small price to pay for traveling through the hallways in discovery of neat features this hotel has to offer. Quiet sleepers beware: the property sits next to Avalon Nightclub which is known for their ongoing heavy bass electronic music after-hour parties (yes low frequency bass waves travel through walls): Friday & Saturday nights this club will go strong until after the sun comes up which should be more of a reason why they should consider keeping the prices slightly lower for the weekend because if you are stuck on the Avalon side of the building you might not be getting much sleep or if your neighbor in the room next door just so happens to be that world famous DJ that just got off his set from the club and decides to continue the party in their room for the night. Since it's opening the hotel has done an excellent job in keeping it's cleanliness but with so much detail involved you can see a little wear starting to show finally. A chipped tile in the shower; scuff marks on some of the hallway and room walls but nothing to complain over since again, the value of this property is still one of the best deals in LA. Small renovations every year should be mandatory given then amount of detail and traffic this place sees. Overall, the best times to truly enjoy this property is on the week-day nights when their aren't so many party-goers involved; walking through the dark halls provides a plush but eerie feeling of being transported to a different time and place where you'll be more than satisfied that you have this place to yourself for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and good design”
Reviews.Author: sdcdd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several days with two teenage daughters. Enough space for us all to eat, sleep and hang out. The staff were nice and the decor is very cool. Great location - beside the action on Hollywood Boulevard; across the road from a good supermarket and surrounded by good restaurants. The hop-on tourist bus, which you can take as far as Venice Beach, stops outside. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and worthy of a special occasion.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGatesNewYork
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Redbury and haven't stayed anywhere quite like it. The location is great for Hollywood - walking distance to a number of bars, restaurants and tourist spots. When entering, it can initially be a little confusing as the restaurant is on the ground floor and hotel check-in is up one level. Once I found the reception desk I had a smooth and courteous check-in. I also started to notice the atmosphere around me -- everything is dimly lit with lots of dark wood and interesting artworks. It's like being in a Scotch-sipping private members club of yesteryear. I read that a renowned photographer helped design the place and it shows -- the lighting is perfect! My room (The Hollywood Premiere Flat) was also pleasantly different. It's designed like an apartment, complete with open-plan kitchen, washer-dryer, large four-poster bed and lounge area. There's a walk-in shower and large vanity area. The balcony has a nice view. My favorite touches included the very-well stocked kitchen (food and alcoholic beverages amongst other things) and the old fashioned record player with its assortment of twelve-inch records! Basically, it's the most perfect hotel room imaginable to host a party - which is what I did! The rooms also have very good sound-proofing - you couldn't hear the faintest murmur of my party from outside in the hallway! I would most certainly stay here again. I did wish that the restaurant opened for lunch and brunch - I would have used it if so. And the wireless internet wasn't free.

Reviews.Title: “What else is there to say, other reviewers have captured it!”
Reviews.Author: chicagowl
Reviews.Content: A great stay when in los Angeles! Rooms are very large, modern, full amenities, comfortable and clean. Very friendly staff and easy check in. Great location. Try to eat at cleo when here, awesome! I have stayed at many hotels in the area and this takes the prize! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Elegant Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: C8201
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 2 nights and loved the place. It is a great location just off Hollywood Boulevard so easy to walk to the local attractions/sights. Apart from Noisy neighbors above us on the first night we had a lovely stay with great comfortable beds and lovely bed linen. Rooms are well done and very elegant. Staff were friendly and Jeff was very helpful and gave us lots of tips for the area. The Hotel car is a bonus and a treat to go anywhere within a 3 km location if it is available. The only down side was the breakfast, this was included in the price but was very basic and were told you could only have one croissant or a piece of toast with one glass of fruit juice and a tea or coffee. Felt a bit stingy compared to the luxurious settings. Would definatley stay again if coming to visit but would not bother with breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scaughto
Reviews.Content: The Redbury Hotel is outstanding. I'd say the Redbury gives its closest competitor (aka The Roosevelt Hotel) a definite run for the money. The Redbury, for as cool/hip as it is, seemed to have a less pretentious vibe. Not to mention (but I will) I thought I might miss hanging out by the pool, but to be honest, not having to be reminded that my body was less than perfect was a nice change of pace (as the Redbury is without a pool). In place of a pool, the Redbury offers "The Library"...a great indoor/outdoor lounge. Finally, the rooms are amazing! The washer/dryer and turn table are nice touches. The rooms feel as though you're staying at a friend's cool condo, downtown (as opposed to a typical hotel room). I will definitely return to The Redbury.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Gonzoxx
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in Hollywood complete with fantastic restaurant. Apartments are spacious and so comfortable with everything you could possibly need during hour stay. There can be some noise from the nightclub next-door depending on where your room is (but you are right in the heart of Hollywood so some noise should be expected). In house car for short trips was an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: deb g
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the redbury in June 11 its a really nice hotel rooms have their own kitchen with minimal cooking items, cutlery and crockery but enough if you wanted to cook something basic. Also has a fridge kettle. Washer dryer in the room also. The bed was comfortable. Downside is no free internet access and also the area felt a little unsafe at night we had travelled San Fran, New York and Vegas this was our last stop and probably the place we felt a little unsure, in saying this the hotel is just up the road from Kodak theatre. shopping mall.Short cab ride to universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a tough critic... But this place get's an A+”
Reviews.Author: donyayeman01
Reviews.Content: I am a tough critic and being in LA a lot, I know that good hotels are hard to find! This place is absolutely great! The service is amazing and the staff is really friendly. The hotel rooms are very big for a hotel in LA and let's just say on my last night, I didn't want to go home! I'd live there if I could. When you first walk in there is a scent that is just to die for. We asked and it's the Redbury signature smell. Their products in the room are like the scent ... and let's just say I can still smell it at home! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy boutique hotel with a cool friendly laid back vibe.”
Reviews.Author: amango3168
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip back in July and again in November. Both times we were upgraded without asking to a 2 bdrm suite. The rooms are huge with everything you could possibly need. Awesome trendy feel and casual vibe here. Good location for restaurants and nightlife, as well as the tourist spots if that's your interest. Service great, especially the concierge services for nightlife suggestions and hookups. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Chic”
Reviews.Author: BeachGal99
Reviews.Content: This was my very favorite hotel of my recent California coast vacation. It was so unique and the most interesting hotel I've ever stayed in. It oozes sexy and cool, from the hotel "library" (bar area) to the fully functional record player in your room. Location in West Hollywood was great, and there were many places to walk to nearby. Customer service was absolutely top notch. This place is perfect for couples who are looking for that that "LA hip/chic vibe". I can't wait to get back to LA to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and records!!!”
Reviews.Author: KSG8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay in Hollywood! Rooms are mini-suites, very spacious with kitchen, living room area, washer/dryer in unit, and patio deck. The design is very eclectic, with record players in the rooms, which is a cool treat; the record selections vary by room, but I believe you can request additional ones if you prefer. My only disappointment with the hotel is the food options. Their menu is very limited and can really only get good options while their main restaurant is open (approx. 7-11a, and from 6p, skipping lunchtime). This isn't a deal-breaker as I'll definitely stay here again (and just bring my food in). All in all, a fantastic find in LA and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, different hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wetravelthere
Reviews.Content: Cool hotel in Hollywood. Walking distance to Chinese Theater. We stayed in a suite and it had a working record player and actual records (if you are under 25 you might not know what this is, he he). Full kitchen, etc. Again, a cool hotel, but it is a little worn--nothing that would make me change my mind about staying here, but I see them needing to make some renovation in the next year or so. Nice experience, nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: LeavingLuma
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Hollywood look no further, this is truly a great palce, home away from home. Record player in room with great tunes was nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfy Suite”
Reviews.Author: 8a8yd011
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. Within walking distance from Chinese Theater, Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, Metro Red Line, great trendy restaurants and many more. My husband and I really didn't need a car during our stay here. We stayed in the Vine Flat with a view of the Capitol Records Building. The room was very comfortable and a nice amenities. I liked that there was a kitchen so we had a place to stash our leftovers from any restaurant we ate from. I also liked that there is a washer and dryer. I didn't get to use it but is very convenient. The bed was ridiculously comfortable. I felt like we were sleeping on a giant fluffy cloud.. AHHH! The TV had DVR and some premium channels... awesome! The only awkward thing about the layout of the flat was the shower. I think its kinda odd that from the bed you can see a blurry outline of the person taking a shower on the other side of the wall. It's okay if you are with your significant other, but what if your staying with some friends? If you want to take a shower, you would have to turn on the light in the shower. The problem with this is that if there's someone sleeping in the bed (on the other side of the shower wall) the light shines brightly on them. All in all, I totally recommend staying here. The staff is very friendly and the housekeeping rocks. I do recommend staying on the higher floors for those who are light sleepers. It did get a little loud at night with the late night crowd roaming the streets. You can hear all the conversations on the street even when all the windows are closed. Luckily I sleep with ear plugs so this wasn't a big issue with me, but it was with my husband. There was so many pluses than minuses during our stay here. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “SPECIAL!”
Reviews.Author: jaxmarquez
Reviews.Content: Great Place & Location if you want to be in the heart of all the action. Rooms are phenominal and very large. Decor is unique,modern,retro & simply put;SPECIAL!! Did not feel like a hotel at all. More like a great flat in the villiage of NYC! Restaurant Cleo's def one of the Best places I've ever eatin. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Simply brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: AJandSJ_syd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Redbury for 5 nights. Literally just checked out this morning. And all I can say is wow! The hotel itself is amazing, from the minute you step inside.. it just feels like Hollywood!Quirky, Retro, Old school charm, with bold modern touches thrown into the mix. Spacious, plenty of natural light and very clean and comfortable room. We stayed in a suite, room 405. It was a great place to come 'home' to every night and highly recommend the room! I was instantly drawn to the old record player and vinyls, and looked forward to spinning Bowie, Beach boys, Commodores, and the doors daily... it seriously adds to the experience. The Staff were friendly, and very helpful, with special mentions to both Ellis and Suzanna - hope i spelt it right ;) . Within hours of our arrival, we had to make our way 30 miles south for a welcoming party. Ellis took the time to ask what our plans for the next few days were, then suggested and arranged a hire car for us to drive ourselves around. Ellis also helped out with some restaurant recommendations and sorted out all of our reservations for us (Picca, The Bazaar by Jose Andres ( a great table by the kitchen where we could see all the food coming out), and Katsuya (reviews for all of these coming up shortly)). Suzanna helped steer us in the right direction for some amazing outlet shopping not too far out, and was always very friendly and welcoming. Location wise.. Brilliant! Within very easy walking distance everything's at your fingertips. A metro station, Trader Joes, a decent Coffee shop (at least the best I found in Hollywood) and no shortage of restaurants, and bars. A few other notes... on some seriously overstated 'bad' points by another reviewer. 'Sheer' curtains are exactly that! And we found the blockout curtains very easy to operate whenever we wanted some privacy :) The remote control was also very easy to operate... Bathroom, agree I like a little more shower pressure. Water was warm enough, but agree it wasn't steamy hot... The basins were huge.. not sure how anyone could struggle to brush their teeth or wash their faces there! All in all, the photos you come across couldn't be more accurate. The staff and their service was personal and highly commendable. Highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again when returning to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like the "New" Hotel California...”
Reviews.Author: ashlee55
Reviews.Content: The Redbury from the moment you walk in makes you feel special (Like your someone important) and welcome. The staff were ultra pleasant and accommodating and the rooms were beautifully decorated! You get a very nice size room for the money as they were built to sell apartments before being bought by SBE. I loved my stay, the beds....AWESOME (I even asked what they were at checkout and received a printout with all the info and will soon be purchasing one). Also check out their restaurant CLEO (it's downstairs) we heard numerous good things from folks around Hollywood but couldn't get a reservation in time :( Redbury was centrally located and close to ALL in the touristy part of Hollywood, make sure to take a couple of hours and wonder around the Hollywood Hills and look at the homes, the hills are right up the road from the hotel! Only CON: The Redbury has a signature scent that flows through the entire building which was not pleasant to me, it's everywhere from the candles at check in to the toiletries in the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms.... HORRIBLE Management!”
Reviews.Author: Fieryembers
Reviews.Content: I originally wasn't going to write a review about my customer service experience...just ways the hotel could improve...but because I still haven't received a response to my email to management I'll have to post it all here. I stayed at the Redbury for an entire week at the end of April so I feel like I got a good feel of how this hotel works. I vacillate between anger at my horrible customer service experience and actual ways the hotel can improve so this review will try to be as levelheaded and fair as I can make it. I hope that the good and bad will be taken as ways they can improve their service in the future! Let's start off with the good! The Good: -Beautifully decorated and huge! A real rock star meets old Hollywood vibe.The smallest is 750 square feet! The bed was soft and comfortable! -There is a DVR in each room so I was able to tape my normal shows and watch them in my vacation downtime! -Location Location Location! It is a one minute walk to the Hollywood and Vine metro station and only a block away from Trader Joe's! -Delicious smelling lotion and shower gel! The Bad: The Cleaning Crew. The maid service times were very sporadic! One day it was finished by 10:00 am other days it hadn't been started by 4:00 pm. I'm quite sure my sheets were not changed every day and the last three days I was missing a top sheet! Other than that the one time I was in the room while she was cleaning-she was efficient and courteous. Individual Coffee Machines. -I understand these are popular nowadays...but really! A six ounce cup of coffee had been almost drained by the time I went to enjoy it on the balcony. I know I used at least 3 coffee pods every morning. A coffee maker would be a lot easier and much more economical! Speaking of coffee... I requested splenda and coffee pods everyday from the cleaning staff (underneath the note I left a generous daily tip) and everyday it was ignored (even though they sure didn't forget the tip) LOL I had to go get the coffee pods myself from Cleo and the front desk every few days. Just a suggestion... only having Bold and Decaf is not the way to go! There are entirely too many flavors to only offer sleepy time tea, decaf and bold coffee! The Bathroom -The rain shower is nice and all if you don't mind the lack of water pressure but the water never got steamy hot...more like luke warm. (I was in 312) -The sink is one of those really sleek flat ones that looks like it needs to be a prop in a sexy commercial. It's completely flat with small beveled edges.Would have been perfect for doing a line of coke in a music video. Not actually conducive for washing your face or brushing your teeth! My room not ready or properly checked! -The day I checked in they hadn't itemized the room properly and as I was unpacking two men (they were quite apologetic) came into the room to check out the minibar and such. -I had to return a DVD that someone had left in the DVD player. There was a vinyl record missing from one of the covers and an open bottle of your water sitting one of the end tables by the couch. Technical Issues! -The lighting system is ridiculous! Every night around 3 am the pot lights over the bed would come on and wake me up. I finally figured out how to fix it...after almost a week of staying there. Not to mention you need a diagram to keep track of all the light switches and what they turn on and off. At least 4 different sets in the kitchen and living room alone! The DVR and remote is way too complicated to work-and I'm a bit of a techie. It's one of those universal remotes and it's just confusing! (see picture) No Car Service as stated on the Website! -The car service...(one of the reasons why I booked The Redbury) was not available. That was a bit annoying but I was told that they would give me a voucher for a cab. Not exactly what I was hoping for decked out to the nines to go to a red carpet event but I didn't have much of a choice. Well I gave them the time and date I would need the cab and I get to the front desk and when I arrived they had no record of it. Sigh:( Luckily the cab company was "right around the corner" and it literally took a few minutes to get to Graumans theater but I ended up paying for the cab myself. The floor to ceiling Windows must come with a disclaimer! -Just a note for the single traveler and non exhibitionist couples...The white sheer shades that filter light so beautifully during the day...are completely transparent at night. I realized (around day five) (when the hotel filled up a bit more) that I could see entirely inside the rooms across the courtyard from me. Like everything! Yes, I'm talking to you certain couple. If there was a light on at all-I could see straight into the room. Please let people know that they might want to draw the black out drapes at night in the rooms facing the courtyard. I wish I would have realized this before traipsing around my room in my underwear or reenacting the entire end scene from West Side Story. (don't ask) A Billing Snafu Times Two (or Three) -The staff tried to charge me twice for internet access even though the terms of my booking offered "FREE INTERNET" -It took three weeks and a call to their billing department for them to release the 1050 (150 a day for a week ) hold on my card. They were apologetic about it but the excuse was that "sorry that week hadn't been batched out properly" -My last billing issue was the straw that broke the proverbial camels back! The Management! UGH! I was locked out of my room on a very early Saturday morning after being at a film fest for almost 16 hours. Long story short. (lol too late?) The manager was rude and treated me like a criminal. I told him that I had been billed that previous Wednesday for the entire amount of my stay (almost 1800 dollars total) and that I had checked my credit card balance that morning like I always do. He said their computer system didn't have any record of it and asked to see proof. (Really? Wow! What happened to the customer is always right?) I had to call my credit card company at 1:00am for them to say... Yes, I had been billed the full amount even though the hotel's computer was showing otherwise. The manager wasn't even apologetic! One faulty computer system and a very tired and embarrassed me later.... I finally got back into my room. The next day I considered leaving-but I figured the refund would be more hassle than it was worth. I even saw that same manager coming out of the Cleo restaurant the next day and he just looked right through me. The management was terrible, and if that situation had been handled with a bit more finesse I wouldn't have left with such a bad taste in my mouth! I expect MORE customer service at a smaller boutique hotel... not less! That manager really cast a pall on what would have been a lovely vacation and first time to Hollywood. On the bright side...all the front desk attendants were nice as they could be. I just wish things would have been handled differently! Well, that was my honest Redbury experience. I still have yet to receive a return email from management which makes me think that due to the amount of glowing reviews they just don't care about the few people who really had some major customer service issues! I hope this is not the norm and I my email was lost or something. Hope you can make an informed decision from this. Customer service is paramount to me so as a consumer you have to decide if style is worth more than substance! The bottom line? Beautiful Hotel but Horrible Management!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nelsonjj
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA for business several times a month, and usually stay at Redbury. This is, by far, my favorite hotel in LA. Possibly one of my favorite hotels, anywhere. Why? The service is great, the room is about the best you could imagine, and the overall experience is just plain cool! Tired of the forgettable Westins, Hiltons and Hyatts that all blend together in a blur of beige and greys? Then you need to stay at the Redbury! This is the ultimate anti-corporate hotel. Yeah, there's no pool or fitness center, but I can do without for one or two nights. I also strongly recommend Cleo, the restuarant. My view of most LA restaurants is that they put atmosphere ahead of food. Cleo, however, is the perfect mix of excellent food and great atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: caatballou
Reviews.Content: Before our long weekend to West Hollywood, I searched the internet for a hotel that had location and comfort. The Redbury appeared to meet our needs. We arrived early and the Redbury allowed us to park and store our bags until the room was ready. So we set out to explore West Hollywood, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. We returned to the hotel late afternoon. Our room was ready, and it exceed our expectations. A full kitchen, living area with a flat screen TV and phonograph with a good supply of LP's, the bedroom area was beautifully decorated and the bed extremely comfortable, the bathroom was wonderful as well. The shower light was out, we asked them to replace the lightbulb and it was done efficiently and quickly. We chose to listen to Alabama on the phonograph, which was fun! The first night in the restaurant Cleo was a new experience for us, small plates with very unique offerings. It was a little dark for us at our table that night, so the next evening we chose to sit at the bar, we thoroughly enjoyed the bartenders and the food! We intend to Return and would recommend The Redbury to all.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst hotel experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: tom n
Reviews.Content: I will keep this review short and sweet DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! They feel empowered that since they are a fancy hotel they can charge you whatever they want for hotel amenities. Whats even worse is that they don't even have the audacity to call you back to discuss terms. I will not get into detail but to sum up this complaint is trust me do not stay here. Trust me there is nothing worse to be at the mercy of someone when they can do what ever they want with it. I always thought it was the other way around, I guess I was wrong!

Reviews.Title: “cool place and location”
Reviews.Author: hotelife
Reviews.Content: The location and vibe are perfect! Obviously very connected to the city and the neighborhood. Great place for extended stays. The company also owns lots of cool restaurant which is really cool and a big benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, retro feel...”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Ddog
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I LOVE this hotel! We've stayed here 3 times now and always enjoy ourselves. The staff is always great and even remembered us from prior visits, which made us feel good, like we're not just random faces they have to help as part of their job. They rooms are so uniquely designed (the whole place is really). I love the living rooms and kitchens so you can stay in and make something if you want. There's a Trader Joes right down the street. My favorite part is the record player and vinyl records. Every room has a different selection. That's the first thing I check when I get in the room. My only complaint would be the lighting in the bathroom. It's pretty dark and makes putting make up on kinda hard, especially if you're trying to dress up at night. The restaurant in the hotel, Cleo, is good. But we really like Katsuya, which is only a block away. Try them both if you get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “The Redbury was very nice, I plan to return soon.”
Reviews.Author: Jackson86
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, excellent location, wonderful staff, very pleased with the Redbury.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: dsmulligan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are stunning. The decor is very hip and sexy. There are full kitchens in all the rooms, and I think most of the rooms have a balcony. The staff is very courteous and was always helpful. I never made it to the bar or restaurant, but heard great things.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to get too excited about.”
Reviews.Author: Keysha M
Reviews.Content: I will first give my pros: The decor was cool. The room had ample closet space, washer/dryer, and kitchenette was nice. The location of the hotel is pretty good. They have a very nice hotel car that drops you off within a 3 mile radius to sightsee. Our driver was nice enough to take us all the way out to the Grove, which was a little bit further out. Now the cons: There are no doors in the room! The toilet has a door, but the bathroom area was extremely open. Whoever is sharing the room with you can actually see you showering! UGH! It would be ok if I'd been alone, but I shared the room with 2 friends. Also, our room faced a nightclub, so that tends to get pretty loud on the weekends. Overall, for the price, I wasn't impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: ayao001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Redbury @ Hollywood and Vine on two occasions. One of them was great, the other time, not so much. Room: Okay, first the pros. The room looks exactly like the photos on the hotel website, spacious, nice decor, and spotlessly clean. And the Vinyl player in the room was especially cute. The bathroom had a very large shower and again, was very clean! The room also had a huge kitchen and washing machine & dryer. Now, to the cons. DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT get their basic room. On the first visit, we got a room with the capitol record view. It's pretty much a view of the street which was fine for us. We loved sitting on our balcony and watching the passing traffic and people. However, on our second visit, we decided to save some money and get their basic room. What a Big Big mistake. The room faces a dirty alleyway, opposite a concrete wall which appears to be the outside of the club. Not only was it super loud, it was also very smelly on the balcony. Our room is probably not even a couple of meters across the concrete wall which makes the whole place feel depressing and claustrophobic. We desperately wanted to change room but the hotel was fully booked. So we sucked it up, kept our curtains closed day and night and checked out the next morning. Service: The service at The Redbury was very mediocre. The workers weren't rude or anything but they didn't seem to make that much of an effort. Other: The valet parking was expensive, but I think it's like this in most hotels in LA. We had Japanese room service on one night, small quantity, very average food and extremely overpriced! There is also no fitness centre on site. i think you can get a free pass to a public gym which is very inconvenient. Location wise, I think it was great for us (We are in our early twenties) but it's definitely not a place for family with kids or people who just wants to relax. It can get a little bit dodgy at night. Overall, the hotel didn't wow us. The decor was nice, but given the price of the rooms, we expected better service and definitely not that awful room we got during our second stay. Don't think we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot To Crash After an After Party”
Reviews.Author: RomanticNHopeless
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip. Entertained in the room which was quite large and had a view of the Capital Records building which was nice. The room was well decorated and had a large balcony which was great too. The rooms have a very cool vibe. There was an old fashioned record player in the room and a stack of vintage vinyl in the room waiting for us to pick from to play. This part of town is not my favorite at all but I was surprised at how nice this hotel was. It was also great to be able to go out to where we needed to go and walk and not worry about drinking and driving or getting a car service or cab. If you have a party at one of the clubs in this part of town then this is a great place to stay. The one knock on this place in my opinion is the neighborhood itself. Despite the city's attempt to clean up this part of town it can still be a bit gritty especially at night. I would not recomend this place for families. Also the cleaning crew had not swept off the balcony from the last guest and there were cigarette butts and ashes so we had to call to get that cleaned. They did come quickly and took care of it however after we called I must say. If staying here I would definatly recomend a walk down the street for dinner at the legendary Musso and Frank. Sitting in those red leather booths and eating in a restaurant Chaplin once dined in is amazing. It is not haute cuisine just a cool old fashioned slice of LA. If I have to come back to this part of town for an event I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Whoa - it's like a swanky Embassy Suites minus kids & free bfast”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSpy
Reviews.Content: First off ... the Redbury can feel like it's trying too hard to be cool (IE: dark hallways, nauseating gardenia smell everywhere) but when we got to our room - we forgot all about that because the room is SO LARGE!! The room is set up like a swanky LA studio with a kitchen, living room, bedroom, walk in shower, separate toilet and an outside deck that looked out on to the downstairs courtyard. We continued to be amazed by the size and the hotel location was spot on. Trader's Joe is one block down, Arklight movie theater is 4 blocks away and the Kodak theater isn't that much further. It has been a long time since we've stumble on such a find ... no hesitation in giving this hotel a THUMBS UP!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ChristyJ123
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED this hotel! The decor was amazing, the vibe was very cool, and the location was great! It was definitely a highlight of our trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Try One Night for the Experience”
Reviews.Author: DebIrvine_CA
Reviews.Content: GRAIN OF SALT: This is written from the perspective of a 50+ couple that appreciates a little city grit, parties just enough to stay within cab range of concerts, requires a good night's sleep, always books the cheapest room in the joint, and can't pass up a novel vibe. Our one-night stay at The Redbury met our requirements with some caveats. We're glad we tried it. CITY GRIT: Accept that in this part of Hollywood, you're always within six giant steps of something grungy. Between The Redbury and scrumptious Juicy Burger or the Pantages, expect to step in a little pee and expect a couple of requests for a buck or a smoke, both within acceptable levels of city gritty. That said, even if you didn't book a view room (see CHEAPEST ROOM), you shouldn't have to expect in-your-face grit when you sit on your balcony. It felt like we could reach out and touch the adjacent Avalon, with its crumbling façade and stinky, noisy ally. Hey, Redbury - how about collaborating with the Avalon for a quick pressure wash and paint job? No? How about something well within your means to mitigate: (1) Add two more privacy panels to the two already hanging on the balcony and (2) clean up the pigeon poop on the balcony floor every now and again. CAB-RIDE CLOSE: This is a terrific base for concerts and theatre. The house ride was available when we were ready to head out to a concert at the Greek. Superior. GOOD NIGHT'S SLEEP: No complaints about the mattress or linens, nor did we experience the noise others did, possibly because we stayed on Sunday night. The too-low lighting and the bed's platform… not a match made in heaven, and I have the bruises to prove it. Redemption came in the form of superb quality blackout curtains on the windows and roller blind on the patio door. Nighty-night, sleep tight! CHEAPEST ROOM: Having booked the smallest size suite AND requesting super-early check-in the morning after a sell-out, I got exactly what I expected (thus the ugly balcony scene). The great thing for the budget-minded is that but for the balcony and square footage (ours was 700+ - who needs more?) the experience (amenities, service) is pretty even across the board. Queue up a little Dark Side of the Moon on the easy-to-use turntable, crank up the AC and the well-positioned ceiling fan, poke through the ample snack baskets, and settle in for some pre-event R&R. Every staff interaction - with valets, house car driver, front desk staff, barista - resulted in engaged, efficient service. NOVEL VIBE: With the exception of the front entry area and Cleo, this is a relentlessly dark space, with deep browns, reds, and blacks competing to dominate dimly-lit public spaces, and in so doing, hiding some really nice appointments and people (gosh, sorry, didn't see you sitting there in your black t-shirt on that brown couch under that 10-watt bulb). And where was the genius hand that dressed Cleo when it came time to do the suites? You know your suite is dark when even the long expanse of butcher block, glossy white kitchen cabinets, and crisp white bed linens can't make a dent. Unmitigated murk is a novel vibe, and we enjoyed it for a little while. Try it for a night. It's the biggest and most unique bang for your buck in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “No pool in the middle of Hollywood!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just after the opening. Interesting room in the heart of Hollywood but lacked a few important things, mainly a Pool. They did make arrangements for us to use the pool at their SLS Hotels property but would of been nice not to drive across town. Lots of Restaurant choices and the Hotels Restaurant was very nice. If staying in Hollywood and want to be close to the Walk of Fame, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Can I just move in?”
Reviews.Author: PhilineV
Reviews.Content: I got a deal on The Redbury through Booking.com, and after reading some of the reviews online at various sites, decided to book it. I'm just SO glad I did. This is a stunning little boutique hotel, gorgeous, spacious, comfortable rooms (even the base level, which I had), seriously comfy bed (had a hard time getting out of it one morning), amazing rain shower, nicely stocked kitchen, wonderful patio on the 2nd floor to hang out on, service is lovely (I forgave them missing my wakeup call my last morning - I booked it late). Major kudos to my gorgeous valet my last morning who, after SuperShuttle left me high and dry, got me a taxi very quickly to get me to LAX. Located at the intersection of iconic Hollywood & Vine and just down the street from the famous round Capital Records Building, the neighborhood is a bit rundown and quiet (but obviously coming up, with this property and the fairly new W around the corner). One quick subway stop to Hollywood & Highland, where there is shopping, Grauman's, and the shuttle to the Hollywood Bowl (major reason I was there), and I hear the buses running along Hollywood Blvd will take you basically just about anywhere you want to get to. I will definitely book this hotel again if I return to LA. Studio apartments in NYC are smaller than the room I had, and really, I just wanted to move in! Oh, and DO notice the wonderful photographs in the lobby areas. One of the owners is a major photog - something I particularly appreciated.....

Reviews.Title: “Fun Treat with Teens”
Reviews.Author: mommamiya
Reviews.Content: My 3 kids and I (20,17&16) stayed 1 night at The Redbury while visiting relatives in LA. We really liked this hotel. Since we usually spend most of our LA time in the Valley or at the beaches, my kids haven't really looked around Hollywood. It is very 'touristy' down there but I really wanted them to experience the area so I booked 2 flats at The Redbury. The hotel itself has a 'Hollywood in Morocco' feel with plush red and brown fabrics balanced with beautiful blown-up photos of movie stars from The Golden Age of Hollywood, Garbo, Harlow, etc.. The staff was very friendly and eager to be helpful. The rooms are large continuing the Moroccan flavor and have mini kitchens with an extensive/expensive mini-bar. Rooms are like studio apartments with comfortable living areas. The bed was cozy and the bathroom was a treat complete with a rain-style shower head and beautiful glass tile. Right away the kids and I put a LP on the record player and enjoyed a David Bowie album while checking out the balcony that overlooked the courtyard/bar/restaurant area. The kids headed out to the Kodiac Theater area and to people watch, I elected to stay in and enjoy the balcony and order room service. It was very good, especially the spicy cigars and hummus and the best buy at the hotel. We had a great time and will probably visit again although it is very pricey. Parking alone was $40/nt which seems about standard in that area. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a night of fun, especially with adults and older teens. I personally would not recommend any Hollywood location to those with small children (under 10).

Reviews.Title: “Great service, spacious rooms and well located!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my two teenagers. They thought it was just perfect! Valet, and check in staff are very professional, friendly and efficient. Highly recommended for anyone! A bit noisy next to the club but all you have to do is keep the fan on the air conditioner on and it will drown out most of the noise. Location is the key here!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Minibar
Reviews.Content: Having just completed a 10 day business trip in the US (and staying at a range of well known 5 star hotels) I arrived at the Redbury. All I can say is -- "this is how you make a hotel". The rooms are generous and stylish. The food is amazing. I almost didn't review it because I didn't want to give away the secret....But it's too good not to be shared. Plus they deserve it. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the chic decor and Hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: Fooie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Redbury for 4 nights at the end of a 2 week US vacation. We loved the size and decor of our Vine room (although it did not have the view of the Hollywood sign as advertised) and found the hotel a good walking distance to the Chinese Theatre and shopping along Hollywood Blvd. The concierge was very helpful. The Redbury was the only place we stayed to charge for internet use ($10 a day). Would definitely stay at the Redbury again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant room and great location!”
Reviews.Author: RoadO
Reviews.Content: We had a sunset flat suite with a rollaway bed in the redbury. This place is very elegant and nice. The staff is very friendly and it is located right nice to the main attratives of Hollywood! It was a peaceful paradise in the middle of a busy tourism district! We loved it! The only thing we don't like is that we dad to pay for the Internet. 10 dollars for 24 hours. In the morning when we were about to check out, we lost our access to the internet although we havent used up 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KCCMEH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel during a very busy period in Hollywood area. Very accommodating staff, comfortable and VERY spacious suites, great decor, clean and FUN. great food at Cleo's. Bar could be bigger and DEFINITELY stay open later in order to dater to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Such a funky, cool place!”
Reviews.Author: lsneed62
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in a different Hollywood hotel but they were booked up so I found The Redbury and they had a special going so I booked a couple nights there, It is really, really nice. The decor is eclectic and trendy, definitely caters to a younger crowd, but the attentive service I recieved was impressive. CONS: I stayed in a suite on the back side and I don't recommend ANYONE do that. While the room was great, it was so dang loud I couldn't sleep. Apparently there's a nightclub below those windows and all the tipsy/drunk party-ers hang out and sing/yell in the alley below as well. Just be sure and ask for a room on any other side than the back!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that is not to sleep in!”
Reviews.Author: maidenvoyager
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the first few days of a road trip around California. We had flown to the US from the UK, so after a long flight, we were looking forward to a few hours relaxing and then having an early night before hitting Hollywood all refreshed the following day. But it wasn't to be...after a couple of hours in the room where we had had the TV on and been unpacking and showering, we decided to call it a night. It was around 10pm and then we could hear the bass of loud music...very loud music. At first we assumed that it might be the hotel bar, but we then realised that it was a nighclub...right next to our room!!! Now, while we were looking to go out and sample the nightlife in Hollywood, we didn't want it in our room! I had brought ear plus with me, as staying downtown, I assumed that there would be some traffic noise. However, ear plugs cannot drown out the bass noise of loud dance music. We tried for about half an hour to get to sleep, but it was no good. We then had to get dressed and go to the hotel reception. There we were told that they could do nothing to help us, we could potentially upgrade, but at considerable cost and not that night. I was very upset, as this was supposed to be a swanky hotel and give us a great start to a special holiday. We contacted Expedia who we had booked the hotel with, and they were brilliant. They liased with the hotel and ensured that we were refunded for the rest of our stay, we booked out the next morning and checked in to the Beverley Hilton instead.

Reviews.Title: “Was looking for a "nonchain" experience. Found it.”
Reviews.Author: Cocoleman
Reviews.Content: I won't bother with descriibing the hotel, this you can look up on the website. The pictures depict the hotel well. Enjoyed the adventure. Imagine a 70's record player in my room with real 70's music! The amenities are a little better than a standard hotel. A kitchenette with microwave and refrigerator are nice. Staff was very helpful and polite. Give them a "10". My provate balcony overlooked Hollywood and Vine (room 214 great location and on the "quieter" side.) Note, overnight parking is $30 per night - too high in my opinion. Overall a very positive experience. The bad? Not recommended for a light sleeper as the local restaurants/bars cater to a 20 - 30 (and I must say overall a most attractive!!!) crowd and doesn't even get started until 8:30 p.m. This is a great place for young couples. For the "nostalgia", the 40-50ish crowd will enjoy the ambience. Although I was on business I wouldn't recommend the Redbury if you plan on doing work in your room as the design and ambience does not provide lighting conducive to reading and working.

Reviews.Title: “Concert - Rod Stewart”
Reviews.Author: MariaRossing
Reviews.Content: Extraordianry hip, classy, classic and chic. I am totally love the hotel and definately will come back. As important, the price is so economically perfect.... I love the Redburry and the DECORS.... Maria Rossing

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy, Very Hollywood, Balanced With Location and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: davestan
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of the newer in Hollywood and well located near Hollywood and Vine. In close proximity were Capitol Records and the fab Pantages Theatre. Stayed 4 nights in a Hollywood Flat at the back of the building. Very trendy and hip with furnishings and decor. We thought it did capture the Hollywood ambience well. The flat was somewhat darkish mainly due to the darker colour scheme and proximity of a large building adjacent which blocked natural light. The advantage of the room location however was that it was away from the potentially noisy nightclub next door. Subdued lighting seems to be part of the overall design of the hotel. Attractive hallways and reception area in deep burgundy colour with large illuminated portraits of classic Hollywood starlets at the ends of the corridors . Our flat was large and well appointed with amenities and technology including mood lighting. Went to the trendy Cleo restaurant one night for dinner which was very nice with predominantly great mezza style food and very good service. Breakfast was basic, but the granola was very good. No real service in the breakfast area and items on some occasions were not readily replenished. We found the staff helpful throughout our stay which is always a major advantage in any Hotel. Overall a comfortable stay and would definately return to the Redbury.

Reviews.Title: “Came for the food, stayed for the night”
Reviews.Author: jess90210
Reviews.Content: We came for dinner at Cleo (great food, friendly staff). Since we had valeted at the restaurant/hotel, after a night out dancing we decided to stay at the Redbury instead of going home. It's a shame we only stayed one night - we got a great upgrade to a drop dead gorgeous room that is bigger than most of the places I've lived in. The decor is modern yet homey with a fun twist with all the records and random stuff in the living area. My partner didn't have a problem with the noise but I didn't get more than an hour of sleep. It was so loud, but given the neighborhood it's expected.

Reviews.Title: “Many KINKS to be worked out!”
Reviews.Author: Bleach82
Reviews.Content: We drove up from Orange County to stay at the Redbury Hotel based on a recommendation from a friend. He said, "It's the coolest new place hands down!" We ended up finding a great deal on Hotels.com... $209 per night for the highland flat I believe it was called. We were happy to have found a deal, and excited to check this place out! We left for LA earlier than we had planned so I called ahead to find out when check-in was and to then make sure our room would be ready by the 3:30 check-in time... We were assured that it would be.
